10618	87	382
10618	88	BioOne
10618	90	www.bioone.org
10618	92	is
10618	93	a
10618	94	nonprofit
10618	96	online
10618	97	aggregation
10618	98	of
10618	99	core
10618	100	research
10618	101	in
10618	102	the
10618	103	biological
10618	105	ecological
10618	107	and
10618	108	environmental
10618	109	sciences

10618	112	provides
10618	113	a
10618	114	sustainable
10618	115	online
10618	116	platform
10618	117	for
10618	118	over
10618	119	170
10618	120	journals
10618	121	and
10618	122	books
10618	123	published
10618	124	by
10618	125	nonprofit
10618	126	societies
10618	128	associations
10618	130	museums
10618	132	institutions
10618	134	and
10618	135	presses

10618	265	MARSH
10618	266	?S
10618	267	DINOSAURS
10618	269	THE
10618	270	COLLECTIONS
10618	271	FROM
10618	272	COMO
10618	273	BLUFF
10618	275	by
10618	276	John
10618	277	H.
10618	278	Ostrom
10618	279	and
10618	280	John
10618	281	S.
10618	282	McIntosh
10618	284	with
10618	285	a
10618	286	new
10618	287	foreword
10618	288	by
10618	289	Peter
10618	290	Dodson
10618	291	and
10618	292	a
10618	293	new
10618	294	historical
10618	295	update
10618	296	by
10618	297	Clifford
10618	298	Miles
10618	299	and
10618	300	David
10618	301	Hamblin
10618	303	416
10618	304	pp
10618	306	168
10618	307	illustrations
10618	309	ISBN
10618	310	0300
10618	311	?
10618	312	-0820
10618	313	?
10618	314	8
10618	316	85.00
10618	318	I
10618	319	was
10618	320	a
10618	321	junior
10618	322	in
10618	323	high
10618	324	school
10618	325	when
10618	326	the
10618	327	?rst
10618	328	edition
10618	329	of
10618	330	Marsh
10618	331	?s
10618	332	Di-nosaurs
10618	333	came
10618	334	out
10618	335	and
10618	336	it
10618	337	was
10618	338	the
10618	339	?rst
10618	340	true
10618	341	scienti?c
10618	342	publication
10618	343	to
10618	344	join
10618	345	my
10618	346	collection
10618	347	of
10618	348	dinosaur
10618	349	books
10618	351	It
10618	352	has
10618	353	remained
10618	354	a
10618	355	major
10618	356	resource
10618	357	for
10618	358	me
10618	359	all
10618	360	those
10618	361	years
10618	362	and
10618	363	it
10618	364	shows
10618	366	the
10618	367	covers
10618	368	have
10618	369	long
10618	370	since
10618	371	fallen
10618	372	off
10618	374	and
10618	375	the
10618	376	pages
10618	377	are
10618	378	dog-eared
10618	379	and
10618	380	stained
10618	382	For
10618	383	me
10618	385	books
10618	386	are
10618	387	tools
10618	388	to
10618	389	be
10618	390	used
10618	392	??written
10618	393	in
10618	395	marked
10618	396	up
10618	398	and
10618	399	sadly
10618	401	eventually
10618	402	worn
10618	403	out
10618	405	Thus
10618	407	it
10618	408	was
10618	409	with
10618	410	delight
10618	411	when
10618	412	I
10618	413	learned
10618	414	that
10618	415	Marsh
10618	416	?s
10618	417	Dinosaurs
10618	418	was
10618	419	to
10618	420	be
10618	421	reprinted
10618	423	The
10618	424	book
10618	425	has
10618	426	two
10618	427	new
10618	428	parts
10618	430	a
10618	431	brief
10618	432	Foreword
10618	433	from
10618	434	one
10618	435	of
10618	436	Ostrom
10618	437	?s
10618	438	former
10618	439	students
10618	441	Peter
10618	442	Dodson
10618	444	and
10618	445	a
10618	446	longer
10618	447	Historical
10618	448	Update
10618	449	on
10618	450	the
10618	451	collecting
10618	452	of
10618	453	dinosaurs
10618	454	in
10618	455	the
10618	456	Corno
10618	457	Bluff
10618	458	region
10618	459	by
10618	460	my
10618	461	colleague
10618	462	Cliff
10618	463	Miles
10618	465	The
10618	466	Foreword
10618	467	encapsulates
10618	468	the
10618	469	impact
10618	470	Marsh
10618	471	had
10618	472	on
10618	473	dinosaur
10618	474	paleontology
10618	475	to
10618	476	this
10618	477	day
10618	478	and
10618	479	the
10618	480	continued
10618	481	in?uence
10618	482	of
10618	483	the
10618	484	lithographs
10618	485	printed
10618	486	in
10618	487	Marsh
10618	488	?s
10618	489	Dinosaurs
10618	491	The
10618	492	Historical
10618	493	Update
10618	494	is
10618	495	an
10618	496	important
10618	497	summary
10618	498	of
10618	499	the
10618	500	work
10618	501	and
10618	502	discoveries
10618	503	made
10618	504	in
10618	505	the
10618	506	past
10618	507	two
10618	508	decades
10618	509	at
10618	510	Corno
10618	511	Bluff
10618	512	and
10618	513	surrounding
10618	514	areas
10618	516	including
10618	517	the
10618	518	?rst
10618	519	discovery
10618	520	of
10618	521	an
10618	522	gastralia
10618	523	set
10618	524	for
10618	525	Apatosaurus
10618	526	by
10618	527	the
10618	528	Tate
10618	529	Museum
10618	530	of
10618	531	Casper
10618	532	College
10618	534	and
10618	535	a
10618	536	nearly
10618	537	complete
10618	538	Camarasaurus
10618	539	grandis
10618	540	by
10618	541	Western
10618	542	Paleontolog-ical
10618	543	Laboratories
10618	545	The
10618	546	original
10618	547	text
10618	548	by
10618	549	Ostrom
10618	550	and
10618	551	McIntosh
10618	552	recounting
10618	553	the
10618	554	discovery
10618	555	and
10618	556	excavation
10618	557	of
10618	558	dinosaurs
10618	559	by
10618	560	crews
10618	561	working
10618	562	for
10618	563	O.
10618	564	C.
10618	565	Marsh
10618	567	is
10618	568	given
10618	569	verbatim
10618	571	There
10618	572	is
10618	573	no
10618	574	attempt
10618	575	to
10618	576	update
10618	577	the
10618	578	information
10618	579	based
10618	580	more
10618	581	current
10618	582	work
10618	584	such
10618	585	as
10618	586	Kohl
10618	587	and
10618	588	McIntosh
10618	590	1997
10618	593	so
10618	594	it
10618	595	is
10618	596	important
10618	597	to
10618	598	keep
10618	599	in
10618	600	mind
10618	601	that
10618	602	this
10618	603	book
10618	604	is
10618	605	a
10618	606	reprint
10618	608	not
10618	609	a
10618	610	second
10618	611	edition
10618	613	The
10618	614	real
10618	616	meat
10618	618	of
10618	619	the
10618	620	book
10618	621	is
10618	623	of
10618	624	course
10618	626	the
10618	627	150
10618	628	lithographic
10618	629	il-lustrations
10618	630	of
10618	631	sauropod
10618	632	and
10618	633	stegosaur
10618	634	bones
10618	636	Marsh
10618	637	had
10618	638	commissioned
10618	639	these
10618	640	and
10618	641	other
10618	642	illustrations
10618	643	while
10618	644	serving
10618	645	as
10618	646	the
10618	647	Vertebrate
10618	648	Paleontol-ogist
10618	649	for
10618	650	the
10618	651	U.S.
10618	652	Geological
10618	653	Survey
10618	655	This
10618	656	position
10618	657	gave
10618	658	him
10618	659	access
10618	660	to
10618	661	a
10618	662	considerable
10618	663	amount
10618	664	of
10618	665	tax
10618	666	payer
10618	667	?s
10618	668	money
10618	670	there
10618	671	are
10618	672	letters
10618	673	in
10618	674	the
10618	675	Marsh
10618	676	correspondence
10618	677	archives
10618	678	that
10618	679	show
10618	680	that
10618	681	this
10618	682	was
10618	683	not
10618	684	a
10618	685	limitless
10618	686	supply
10618	689	Marsh
10618	690	had
10618	691	planned
10618	692	about
10618	693	six
10618	694	monographs
10618	695	when
10618	696	the
10618	697	lithographs
10618	698	were
10618	699	commissioned
10618	701	of
10618	702	which
10618	703	the
10618	704	Dinocerata
10618	705	and
10618	706	Odontornithes
10618	707	were
10618	708	completed
10618	709	and
10618	710	published
10618	711	before
10618	712	Marsh
10618	713	?s
10618	714	death
10618	716	Another
10618	717	monograph
10618	719	the
10618	720	Ceratopsia
10618	722	was
10618	723	completed
10618	724	after
10618	725	his
10618	726	death
10618	727	by
10618	728	John
10618	729	Hatcher
10618	730	and
10618	731	Richard
10618	732	Lull
10618	734	and
10618	735	the
10618	736	T
10618	737	itanotheres
10618	738	was
10618	739	completed
10618	740	by
10618	741	Henry
10618	742	Osborn
10618	744	Two
10618	745	other
10618	746	monographs
10618	747	on
10618	748	the
10618	749	Sauropoda
10618	750	and
10618	751	Stegosauria
10618	752	were
10618	753	planned
10618	754	but
10618	755	never
10618	756	completed
10618	758	It
10618	759	is
10618	760	the
10618	761	lithographs
10618	762	for
10618	763	these
10618	764	monographs
10618	765	that
10618	766	Ostrom
10618	767	and
10618	768	McIntosh
10618	769	published
10618	771	The
10618	772	original
10618	773	illustrations
10618	774	are
10618	775	true
10618	776	works
10618	777	of
10618	778	art
10618	779	and
10618	780	it
10618	781	is
10618	782	unfortunate
10618	783	that
10618	784	photographs
10618	785	have
10618	786	now
10618	787	superceded
10618	788	lithographs
10618	789	in
10618	790	scienti?c
10618	791	papers
10618	793	Most
10618	794	of
10618	795	the
10618	796	bones
10618	797	illustrated
10618	798	are
10618	799	in
10618	800	multiple
10618	801	views
10618	803	including
10618	804	both
10618	805	the
10618	806	proximal
10618	807	and
10618	808	distal
10618	809	ends
10618	810	of
10618	811	limb
10618	812	elements
10618	814	Almost
10618	815	all
10618	816	of
10618	817	the
10618	818	bones
10618	819	look
10618	821	perfect
10618	824	with
10618	825	no
10618	826	crushing
10618	827	and
10618	828	with
10618	829	few
10618	830	missing
10618	831	parts
10618	833	While
10618	834	it
10618	835	is
10618	836	true
10618	837	that
10618	838	many
10618	839	bones
10618	840	do
10618	841	look
10618	842	much
10618	843	like
10618	844	the
10618	845	illustrations
10618	847	e.g.
10618	849	tibia
10618	850	of
10618	851	Stego
10618	853	saurus
10618	854	duplex
10618	857	not
10618	858	all
10618	859	do
10618	861	As
10618	862	Erwin
10618	863	Barbour
10618	865	1890
10618	867	has
10618	868	charged
10618	870	some
10618	871	bones
10618	872	are
10618	873	less
10618	874	than
10618	875	perfect
10618	877	but
10618	878	no
10618	879	hint
10618	880	of
10618	881	the
10618	882	imperfections
10618	883	have
10618	884	been
10618	885	given
10618	886	in
10618	887	the
10618	888	?gures
10618	890	dotted
10618	891	lines
10618	893	etc.
10618	896	except
10618	897	in
10618	898	a
10618	899	few
10618	901	e.g.
10618	903	Plate
10618	904	32
10618	907	An
10618	908	example
10618	909	of
10618	910	a
10618	911	perfect
10618	912	bone
10618	913	that
10618	914	really
10618	915	is
10618	916	n?t
10618	918	is
10618	919	a
10618	920	sauropod
10618	921	cervical
10618	922	vertebra
10618	923	shown
10618	924	in
10618	925	Plate
10618	926	15
10618	928	Barbour
10618	929	shows
10618	930	that
10618	931	the
10618	932	vertebra
10618	933	was
10618	934	not
10618	935	as
10618	936	complete
10618	937	as
10618	938	Marsh
10618	939	had
10618	940	illustrated
10618	942	Barbour
10618	944	l890
10618	946	?g
10618	947	.
10618	948	1
10618	951	Still
10618	953	we
10618	954	may
10618	955	forgive
10618	956	Marsh
10618	957	for
10618	958	making
10618	959	the
10618	960	bones
10618	961	look
10618	962	more
10618	963	than
10618	964	perfect
10618	966	after
10618	967	all
10618	968	Jim
10618	969	Madsen
10618	970	?s
10618	972	1976
10618	974	Allosaurus
10618	975	monograph
10618	976	as
10618	977	done
10618	978	the
10618	979	same
10618	980	thing
10618	982	Marsh
10618	983	?s
10618	984	Dinosaur
10618	985	as
10618	986	a
10618	987	reprint
10618	988	suffers
10618	989	from
10618	990	the
10618	991	usual
10618	992	problem
10618	993	of
10618	994	re-printing
10618	995	a
10618	996	book
10618	998	namely
10618	999	the
10618	1000	illustrations
10618	1001	are
10618	1002	not
10618	1003	as
10618	1004	good
10618	1005	as
10618	1006	the
10618	1007	original
10618	1009	Most
10618	1010	of
10618	1011	the
10618	1012	shadows
10618	1013	are
10618	1014	so
10618	1015	dark
10618	1016	as
10618	1017	to
10618	1018	appear
10618	1019	black
10618	1020	in
10618	1021	some
10618	1022	cases
10618	1024	Although
10618	1025	this
10618	1026	is
10618	1027	n?t
10618	1028	too
10618	1029	much
10618	1030	of
10618	1031	a
10618	1032	problem
10618	1033	for
10618	1034	many
10618	1035	of
10618	1036	the
10618	1037	bones
10618	1038	illus-trate
10618	1039	d,
10618	1040	it
10618	1041	is
10618	1042	for
10618	1043	the
10618	1044	skull
10618	1045	of
10618	1046	Diplodocus
10618	1047	where
10618	1048	details
10618	1049	in
10618	1050	the
10618	1051	shadows
10618	1052	are
10618	1053	practically
10618	1054	indiscernible
10618	1056	for
10618	1057	some
10618	1058	reason
10618	1059	the
10618	1060	skull
10618	1061	images
10618	1062	of
10618	1063	Stego
10618	1065	saurus
10618	1066	did
10618	1067	not
10618	1068	suffer
10618	1069	the
10618	1070	same
10618	1071	fate
10618	1074	I
10618	1075	do
10618	1076	not
10618	1077	understand
10618	1078	why
10618	1080	with
10618	1081	the
10618	1082	advances
10618	1083	in
10618	1084	digital
10618	1085	imagery
10618	1087	illustrations
10618	1088	in
10618	1089	any
10618	1090	reprinted
10618	1091	book
10618	1092	are
10618	1093	so
10618	1094	poor
10618	1095	Marsh
10618	1096	?s
10618	1097	Dinosaurs
10618	1098	is
10618	1099	a
10618	1100	close
10618	1102	but
10618	1103	not
10618	1104	exact
10618	1105	reproduction
10618	1106	of
10618	1107	the
10618	1108	orig-ina
10618	1109	l.
10618	1110	The
10618	1111	frontispiece
10618	1112	illustration
10618	1113	is
10618	1114	now
10618	1115	black
10618	1116	and
10618	1117	white
10618	1119	rather
10618	1120	than
10618	1121	colored
10618	1123	Several
10618	1124	illustrations
10618	1125	that
10618	1126	were
10618	1127	large
10618	1128	foldouts
10618	1129	now
10618	1130	have
10618	1131	a
10618	1132	bind-ing
10618	1133	seam
10618	1134	through
10618	1135	them
10618	1137	for
10618	1138	example
10618	1139	Figure
10618	1140	3
10618	1142	map
10618	1143	showing
10618	1144	the
10618	1145	location
10618	1146	of
10618	1147	quarries
10618	1148	at

10618	1152	Plate
10618	1153	32

10618	1156	caudal
10618	1157	vertebra

10618	1161	should

10618	1163	buy

10618	1165	book

10618	1182	older

10618	1371	0365-7000

10618	1374	3-7829-2556-4
10618	1376	The
10618	1377	Late
10618	1378	Jurassic
10618	1379	land-vertebrate
10618	1380	fauna
10618	1381	from
10618	1382	Guimarota
10618	1384	Portugal
10618	1385	Holotheria
10618	1386	includes
10618	1387	a
10618	1388	broad
10618	1389	diversity
10618	1390	of
10618	1391	living
10618	1392	and
10618	1393	extinct

10618	1395	unit
10618	1397	stands
10618	1398	as
10618	1399	a
10618	1400	unique
10618	1402	international
10618	1403	treasure
10618	1405	A
10618	1406	particularly
10618	1407	important
10618	1408	cor

10618	1410	ed
10618	1411	by
10618	1412	ancestors

10618	1414	molars
10618	1415	with
10618	1416	the
10618	1417	primary
10618	1418	cusps
10618	1419	arranged
10618	1420	in

10618	1423	ponent
10618	1424	of
10618	1425	the
10618	1426	fauna
10618	1427	is
10618	1428	the
10618	1429	mammals
10618	1431	which
10618	1432	have
10618	1433	provided
10618	1434	much
10618	1435	insight
10618	1436	angular
10618	1437	patterns
10618	1439	as
10618	1440	seen
10618	1441	in
10618	1442	occlusal
10618	1443	views
10618	1445	with
10618	1446	apices
10618	1447	of
10618	1448	the
10618	1449	triangles
10618	1450	to
10618	1451	evolutionary
10618	1452	steps
10618	1453	within
10618	1454	that
10618	1455	group
10618	1456	?s
10618	1457	Mesozoic
10618	1458	history
10618	1460	This
10618	1461	mono
10618	1463	oriented
10618	1464	in
10618	1465	opposite
10618	1466	directions
10618	1467	between
10618	1468	upper
10618	1469	and
10618	1470	lower
10618	1471	teeth
10618	1473	Members
10618	1474	graph
10618	1475	by
10618	1476	Thomas
10618	1477	Martin
10618	1478	opens
10618	1479	new
10618	1480	vistas
10618	1481	within
10618	1482	the
10618	1483	mammalian
10618	1484	group
10618	1485	of
10618	1486	the
10618	1487	Late
10618	1488	Triassic
10618	1492	Early
10618	1493	Jurassic
10618	1494	Kuehneotheriidae
10618	1495	are
10618	1496	the
10618	1497	most
10618	1498	prim
10618	1500	known
10618	1501	as
10618	1502	the
10618	1503	holotherians
10618	1505	itive
10618	1506	known
10618	1507	holotherians
10618	1509	and
10618	1510	living
10618	1511	marsupials
10618	1512	and
10618	1513	placentals
10618	1514	are
10618	1515	highBOOK
10618	1516	REUIEWS
10618	1517	785
10618	1518	ly
10618	1519	specialized
10618	1520	holotherians
10618	1522	Between
10618	1523	these
10618	1524	end
10618	1526	members
10618	1527	are
10618	1528	the
10618	1529	sym-metrodonts
10618	1530	and
10618	1532	eupantotheres
10618	1535	which
10618	1536	both
10618	1537	contain
10618	1538	species
10618	1539	that
10618	1540	var-iously
10618	1541	exhibit
10618	1542	unique
10618	1543	anatomical
10618	1544	specializations
10618	1545	or
10618	1546	demonstrate
10618	1547	condi-tions
10618	1548	that
10618	1549	presage
10618	1550	holotherians
10618	1552	Martin
10618	1553	?s
10618	1554	monograph
10618	1555	focuses
10618	1556	on
10618	1557	Portuguese
10618	1558	representatives
10618	1559	of
10618	1560	one
10618	1561	family
10618	1563	Dryolestidae
10618	1565	of
10618	1566	the
10618	1567	eupan-tothere
10618	1568	s.
10618	1569	He
10618	1570	does
10618	1571	not
10618	1572	consider
10618	1573	the
10618	1575	Eupantotheria
10618	1577	as
10618	1578	a
10618	1579	formal
10618	1580	taxo-nomic
10618	1581	unit
10618	1583	but
10618	1584	instead
10618	1585	an
10618	1586	ill
10618	1588	de?ned
10618	1589	grade
10618	1590	of
10618	1591	extinct
10618	1593	non
10618	1595	tribosphenic
10618	1596	mammals
10618	1597	in
10618	1598	which
10618	1599	most
10618	1600	representatives
10618	1601	have
10618	1602	an
10618	1603	unbasined
10618	1605	single-cusped
10618	1606	heel
10618	1608	talonid
10618	1610	on
10618	1611	their
10618	1612	lower
10618	1613	molars
10618	1615	As
10618	1616	discussed
10618	1617	by
10618	1618	Martin
10618	1620	dryolestids
10618	1621	are
10618	1622	the
10618	1623	most
10618	1624	diverse
10618	1625	and
10618	1626	longest-lived
10618	1627	known
10618	1628	group
10618	1629	of
10618	1630	pre
10618	1632	tribosphenic
10618	1633	holotherians
10618	1635	Also
10618	1637	in
10618	1638	terms
10618	1639	of
10618	1640	diversity
10618	1641	and
10618	1642	abundance
10618	1643	as
10618	1644	fossils
10618	1646	dryolestids
10618	1647	were
10618	1648	the
10618	1649	dominant
10618	1650	hol-otherians
10618	1651	during
10618	1652	the
10618	1653	Late
10618	1654	Jurassic
10618	1655	and
10618	1656	Early
10618	1657	Cretaceous
10618	1659	Although
10618	1660	not
10618	1661	directly
10618	1662	ancestral
10618	1664	dryolestids
10618	1665	are
10618	1666	closely
10618	1667	related
10618	1668	to
10618	1669	tribosphenids
10618	1672	Ae
10618	1674	gialodontia
10618	1675	plus
10618	1676	Theria
10618	1679	Tribosphenids
10618	1680	primitively
10618	1681	have
10618	1682	a
10618	1683	strongly
10618	1684	de-veloped
10618	1685	protocone
10618	1686	that
10618	1687	occludes
10618	1688	into
10618	1689	a
10618	1690	de?nitely
10618	1691	basined
10618	1692	talonid
10618	1693	on
10618	1694	the
10618	1695	lower
10618	1696	molars
10618	1698	Dryolestids
10618	1699	are
10618	1700	considered
10618	1701	the
10618	1702	sister
10618	1704	group
10618	1705	of
10618	1706	Peramus
10618	1707	and
10618	1708	its
10618	1709	allies
10618	1710	plus
10618	1711	Tribosphenida
10618	1713	and
10618	1714	thus
10618	1715	were
10618	1716	close
10618	1717	to
10618	1718	the
10618	1719	common
10618	1720	stem
10618	1721	of
10618	1722	marsupials
10618	1723	and
10618	1724	placentals
10618	1726	Species
10618	1727	of
10618	1728	dryolestids
10618	1730	therefore
10618	1732	have
10618	1733	become
10618	1734	central
10618	1735	to
10618	1736	understanding
10618	1737	the
10618	1738	early
10618	1739	evolution
10618	1740	of
10618	1741	tribos-phenic
10618	1742	mammals
10618	1744	Previous
10618	1745	investigations
10618	1746	of
10618	1747	dryolestids
10618	1748	were
10618	1749	based
10618	1750	mainly
10618	1751	upon
10618	1752	fossils
10618	1753	from
10618	1754	the
10618	1755	Morrison
10618	1756	Formation
10618	1757	of
10618	1758	the
10618	1759	North
10618	1760	American
10618	1761	Rocky
10618	1762	Mountains
10618	1763	and
10618	1764	the
10618	1765	approximately
10618	1766	contemporaneous
10618	1767	Purbeck
10618	1768	beds
10618	1769	of
10618	1770	southern
10618	1771	Eng-lan
10618	1772	d;
10618	1773	most
10618	1774	of
10618	1775	the
10618	1776	specimens
10618	1777	were
10618	1778	fragmentary
10618	1779	jaws
10618	1780	and
10618	1781	isolated
10618	1782	teeth
10618	1784	In
10618	1785	marked
10618	1786	contrast
10618	1788	the
10618	1789	present
10618	1790	study
10618	1791	had
10618	1792	about
10618	1793	400
10618	1794	available
10618	1795	dryolestid
10618	1796	dentitions
10618	1798	some
10618	1799	essentially
10618	1800	complete
10618	1802	The
10618	1803	focus
10618	1804	of
10618	1805	this
10618	1806	study
10618	1807	involved
10618	1808	two
10618	1809	collecting
10618	1810	areas
10618	1811	in
10618	1812	southwestern
10618	1813	Portugal
10618	1815	both
10618	1816	north
10618	1817	of
10618	1818	Lisbon
10618	1820	The
10618	1821	richer
10618	1822	area
10618	1823	is
10618	1824	from
10618	1825	an
10618	1826	abandoned
10618	1828	underground
10618	1829	lignite
10618	1830	mine
10618	1831	in
10618	1832	a
10618	1833	southern
10618	1834	district
10618	1835	of
10618	1836	the
10618	1837	city
10618	1838	of
10618	1839	Leiria
10618	1840	known
10618	1841	as
10618	1842	Guimarota
10618	1844	Fossils
10618	1845	were
10618	1846	collected
10618	1847	at
10618	1848	the
10618	1849	Guimarota
10618	1850	mine
10618	1851	by
10618	1852	paleontologists
10618	1853	from
10618	1854	the
10618	1855	Free
10618	1856	Uni-versity
10618	1857	of
10618	1858	Berlin
10618	1859	after
10618	1860	commercial
10618	1861	mining
10618	1862	had
10618	1863	stopped
10618	1865	Collecting
10618	1866	was
10618	1867	prolonged
10618	1868	at
10618	1869	Guimarota
10618	1871	initiated
10618	1872	through
10618	1873	the
10618	1874	interval
10618	1875	of
10618	1876	1952???1962
10618	1877	and
10618	1878	resuming
10618	1880	much
10618	1881	more
10618	1882	intensely
10618	1884	from
10618	1885	1973???19
10618	1886	82.
10618	1887	As
10618	1888	a
10618	1889	result
10618	1890	of
10618	1891	collecting
10618	1892	and
10618	1893	curatorial
10618	1894	efforts
10618	1895	that
10618	1896	can
10618	1897	only
10618	1898	be
10618	1899	considered
10618	1900	heroic

10618	1903	now

10618	1906	richest
10618	1907	and
10618	1908	most
10618	1909	diverse

10618	1911	of

10618	1913	Jurassic

10618	1917	vertebrates
10618	1918	known
10618	1919	to

10618	1921	paleontological

10618	1928	recovered
10618	1929	by
10618	1930	the
10618	1931	same
10618	1932	German
10618	1933	teams
10618	1934	from
10618	1935	the
10618	1936	beautiful
10618	1937	sea
10618	1938	cliffs
10618	1939	at
10618	1940	Porto
10618	1941	Pinheiro
10618	1943	southwest
10618	1944	of
10618	1945	the
10618	1946	town
10618	1947	of
10618	1948	Lourinha
10618	1950	halfway
10618	1951	between
10618	1952	Lisbon
10618	1953	and
10618	1954	Leiria
10618	1957	Martin
10618	1958	?s
10618	1959	monograph
10618	1960	provides
10618	1961	the
10618	1962	best
10618	1963	maps
10618	1964	published
10618	1965	for
10618	1966	locating
10618	1967	the
10618	1968	sites
10618	1969	of
10618	1970	Guimarota
10618	1971	and
10618	1972	Porto
10618	1973	Pinheiro
10618	1975	Dryolestids
10618	1976	compose
10618	1977	about
10618	1978	half
10618	1979	of
10618	1980	the
10618	1981	mammalian
10618	1982	specimens
10618	1983	from
10618	1984	Guimarota
10618	1986	The
10618	1987	others
10618	1988	include
10618	1989	paurodontids
10618	1991	another
10618	1992	family
10618	1993	of
10618	1995	eupan-tothere
10618	1996	"
10618	1999	a
10618	2000	considerable
10618	2001	variety
10618	2002	of
10618	2003	multituberculates
10618	2005	and
10618	2006	a
10618	2007	single
10618	2009	enigmatic
10618	2010	species
10618	2011	of
10618	2012	docodont
10618	2014	Despite
10618	2015	the
10618	2016	large
10618	2017	numbers
10618	2018	of
10618	2019	specimens
10618	2021	overall
10618	2022	taxonomic
10618	2023	diversity
10618	2024	of
10618	2025	mammals
10618	2026	from
10618	2027	Guimarota
10618	2028	is
10618	2029	not
10618	2030	great
10618	2032	Martin
10618	2033	relates
10618	2034	the
10618	2035	peculiar
10618	2036	faunal
10618	2037	make
10618	2039	up
10618	2040	to
10618	2041	an
10618	2042	extreme
10618	2043	depositional
10618	2044	setting
10618	2045	in
10618	2046	a
10618	2047	coastal
10618	2048	swamp
10618	2050	Dinosaurs
10618	2051	are
10618	2052	represented
10618	2053	mostly
10618	2054	by
10618	2055	juve-nile
10618	2056	s,
10618	2057	and
10618	2058	theropods
10618	2059	constitute
10618	2060	about
10618	2061	90
10618	2062	percent
10618	2063	of
10618	2064	the
10618	2065	isolated
10618	2066	tooth
10618	2067	fossils
10618	2069	Possibly
10618	2070	the
10618	2071	rare
10618	2072	species
10618	2073	lived
10618	2074	in
10618	2075	the
10618	2076	drier
10618	2077	uplands
10618	2079	and
10618	2080	their
10618	2081	remains
10618	2082	were
10618	2083	carried
10618	2084	only
10618	2085	by
10618	2086	accident
10618	2087	to
10618	2088	points
10618	2089	of
10618	2090	preservation
10618	2091	in
10618	2092	the
10618	2093	coastal
10618	2094	lowlands
10618	2095	of
10618	2096	Guimarota
10618	2098	The
10618	2099	oldest
10618	2100	known
10618	2101	dryolestids
10618	2102	come
10618	2103	from
10618	2104	the
10618	2105	late
10618	2106	Bathonian
10618	2107	Forest
10618	2108	Marble
10618	2109	of
10618	2110	Oxfordshire
10618	2112	England
10618	2114	Dryolestids
10618	2115	from
10618	2116	Guimarota
10618	2118	however
10618	2120	are
10618	2121	the
10618	2122	oldest
10618	2123	well
10618	2125	known
10618	2126	representatives
10618	2127	of
10618	2128	the
10618	2129	family
10618	2131	Despite
10618	2132	their
10618	2133	antiquity
10618	2135	species
10618	2136	from
10618	2137	Guimarota
10618	2138	already
10618	2139	exhibit
10618	2140	the
10618	2141	anteroposteriorly
10618	2142	compressed
10618	2143	molars
10618	2144	characteristic
10618	2145	of
10618	2146	the
10618	2147	family
10618	2149	as
10618	2150	well
10618	2151	as
10618	2152	strongly
10618	2153	asymmetrical
10618	2154	roots
10618	2156	larger
10618	2157	anterior
10618	2158	root
10618	2160	much
10618	2161	smaller
10618	2162	posterior
10618	2163	root
10618	2165	and
10618	2166	high
10618	2167	molar
10618	2168	count
10618	2170	Species
10618	2171	from
10618	2172	Guimarota
10618	2173	are
10618	2174	more
10618	2175	primitive
10618	2177	and
10618	2178	thus
10618	2179	probably
10618	2180	somewhat
10618	2181	older
10618	2183	than
10618	2184	their
10618	2185	closest
10618	2186	relatives
10618	2187	from
10618	2188	the
10618	2189	Mor-rison
10618	2190	Formation
10618	2191	and
10618	2192	English
10618	2193	Weald
10618	2195	Dentally
10618	2196	advanced
10618	2197	forms
10618	2198	such
10618	2199	as
10618	2200	Laolestes
10618	2201	are
10618	2202	absent
10618	2203	at
10618	2204	Guimarota
10618	2206	Martin
10618	2207	considers
10618	2208	the
10618	2209	age
10618	2210	of
10618	2211	Morrison
10618	2212	Formation
10618	2213	in
10618	2214	the
10618	2215	traditional
10618	2216	sense
10618	2218	i.e.
10618	2220	late
10618	2221	Kimmeridgian
10618	2223	using
10618	2224	Eu-ropean
10618	2225	terminology
10618	2228	He
10618	2229	thinks
10618	2230	the
10618	2231	sites
10618	2232	at
10618	2233	Porto
10618	2234	Pinheiro
10618	2235	are
10618	2236	younger
10618	2237	than
10618	2238	that
10618	2240	specifically
10618	2241	late
10618	2242	Kimmeridgian
10618	2243	or
10618	2244	early
10618	2245	Berriasian
10618	2247	strata
10618	2248	at
10618	2249	Porto
10618	2250	Pinheiro
10618	2252	therefore
10618	2254	he
10618	2255	considers
10618	2256	to
10618	2257	have
10618	2258	been
10618	2259	deposited
10618	2260	close
10618	2261	to
10618	2262	the
10618	2263	Jurassic
10618	2267	Cretaceous
10618	2268	boundary
10618	2270	Martin
10618	2271	recognizes
10618	2272	three
10618	2273	new
10618	2274	genera
10618	2275	of
10618	2276	endemic
10618	2277	Portuguese
10618	2278	dryoles-tid
10618	2279	s,
10618	2280	as
10618	2281	well

10618	2283	two
10618	2284	new
10618	2285	species
10618	2286	of
10618	2287	pre-existing
10618	2288	genera

10618	2292	s,
10618	2293	sp
10618	2295	nov.
10618	2297	which
10618	2298	has
10618	2299	a
10618	2300	3.5
10618	2301	cm-long
10618	2302	mandible
10618	2304	and
10618	2305	Krebsotherium

10618	2309	et
10618	2310	sp

10618	2314	2.5
10618	2315	cm-long

10618	2318	are
10618	2319	known
10618	2320	from
10618	2321	upper
10618	2322	and
10618	2323	lower

10618	2329	dryolestids

10618	2352	and
10618	2353	teeth

10618	2360	nov.

10618	2368	sp

10618	2385	their

10618	2387	from
10618	2388	Guimarota
10618	2390	Martin
10618	2391	considers
10618	2393	Butlerigale
10618	2395	of
10618	2396	Kiihne
10618	2398	originally
10618	2399	a
10618	2400	nomen
10618	2401	nudum

10618	2404	a
10618	2405	possibly
10618	2406	pathological
10618	2407	variant
10618	2408	within

10618	2410	species

10618	2412	of
10618	2413	Dryolestes

10618	2418	upon
10618	2419	new
10618	2421	personal
10618	2422	observations
10618	2423	of
10618	2424	type
10618	2425	materials

10618	2432	extensive
10618	2433	section

10618	2435	taxonomic

10618	2437	of
10618	2438	dryolestids
10618	2439	from
10618	2440	the
10618	2441	Morrison

10618	2447	relationships
10618	2448	of
10618	2449	Morrison

10618	2451	are

10618	2453	follows
10618	2455	Dryolestes
10618	2456	leiriensis
10618	2457	is
10618	2458	highly
10618	2459	similar
10618	2460	to
10618	2461	the
10618	2462	lower
10618	2463	jaw
10618	2464	species
10618	2465	Dryolestes
10618	2466	priscus
10618	2467	of
10618	2468	the
10618	2469	Rockies
10618	2471	upper
10618	2472	teeth
10618	2473	of
10618	2474	D.
10618	2475	leiriensis
10618	2476	closely
10618	2477	resemble
10618	2478	the
10618	2479	upper
10618	2480	jaw
10618	2481	species
10618	2482	Herpetairus
10618	2483	arcuatus
10618	2484	of
10618	2485	the
10618	2486	Morrison
10618	2487	Formation
10618	2489	and
10618	2490	Herpe-tairus
10618	2491	is
10618	2492	judged
10618	2493	a
10618	2494	junior
10618	2495	synonym
10618	2496	of
10618	2497	Dryolestes
10618	2499	Krebsotherium
10618	2500	rep-resents
10618	2501	a
10618	2502	lineage
10618	2503	that
10618	2504	led
10618	2505	to
10618	2506	Amblotherium
10618	2507	of
10618	2508	Europe
10618	2509	and
10618	2510	the
10618	2511	Rockies
10618	2513	Laolestes
10618	2515	the
10618	2516	senior
10618	2517	genus
10618	2519	is
10618	2520	the
10618	2521	lower
10618	2522	dentition
10618	2523	of
10618	2524	Melanodon
10618	2526	also
10618	2527	of
10618	2528	both
10618	2529	continents
10618	2531	Amblotherium
10618	2532	gracilis
10618	2533	is
10618	2534	the
10618	2535	senior
10618	2536	synonym
10618	2537	of
10618	2538	both
10618	2539	Amblotherium
10618	2540	debilis
10618	2541	and
10618	2542	Kepolestes
10618	2543	coloradensisg
10618	2544	Malthacolestes
10618	2545	os-borni
10618	2546	is
10618	2547	the
10618	2548	deciduous
10618	2549	upper
10618	2550	dentition
10618	2551	of
10618	2552	Laolestes
10618	2554	which
10618	2555	is
10618	2556	the
10618	2557	older
10618	2558	name
10618	2560	and
10618	2561	Euthlastus
10618	2562	cordiformis
10618	2563	and
10618	2564	Comotherium

10618	2567	be
10618	2568	considered
10618	2569	paurodontids

10618	2572	dryolestids

10618	2575	to
10618	2576	that
10618	2577	last

10618	2580	Martin
10618	2581	provides
10618	2582	a
10618	2583	good
10618	2584	de?nition
10618	2585	of
10618	2586	the
10618	2587	Dryolestidae

10618	2589	well
10618	2590	as
10618	2591	the
10618	2592	practical
10618	2593	means
10618	2594	by
10618	2595	which
10618	2596	its
10618	2597	lower
10618	2598	and
10618	2599	upper
10618	2600	molars

10618	2602	be
10618	2603	distin-guished
10618	2604	from
10618	2605	those
10618	2606	of
10618	2607	paurodontids
10618	2609	Martin
10618	2610	?s
10618	2611	Table
10618	2612	1
10618	2613	gives
10618	2614	a
10618	2615	useful

10618	2617	of
10618	2618	presently
10618	2619	valid
10618	2620	dryolestid

10618	2632	geo-logic
10618	2633	ages
10618	2635	Procedurally
10618	2637	the
10618	2638	table
10618	2639	is
10618	2640	?awed
10618	2641	in
10618	2642	citing
10618	2643	the
10618	2644	names
10618	2645	of
10618	2646	new
10618	2647	taxa
10618	2648	on
10618	2649	a
10618	2650	page
10618	2651	in
10618	2652	advance
10618	2653	of
10618	2654	their
10618	2655	formal
10618	2656	introduction
10618	2657	to
10618	2658	the
10618	2659	paleon-tological
10618	2660	literature
10618	2662	That
10618	2663	is
10618	2664	only
10618	2665	a
10618	2666	minor
10618	2667	criticism
10618	2669	however
10618	2671	and
10618	2672	in
10618	2673	most
10618	2674	other
10618	2675	respects

10618	2677	monograph

10618	2679	serve
10618	2680	as
10618	2681	a
10618	2682	model
10618	2683	for
10618	2684	the
10618	2685	manner
10618	2686	in
10618	2687	which
10618	2688	detailed
10618	2689	descriptive
10618	2690	paleontology
10618	2691	should
10618	2692	be
10618	2693	presented
10618	2695	For
10618	2696	example
10618	2698	Martin
10618	2699	lists
10618	2700	all
10618	2701	specimens
10618	2702	studied
10618	2703	along
10618	2704	with
10618	2705	brief
10618	2706	descriptions
10618	2707	of
10618	2708	materials
10618	2709	represented
10618	2710	by
10618	2711	each
10618	2712	specimen
10618	2713	number
10618	2715	He
10618	2716	also
10618	2717	gives
10618	2719	pure
10618	2721	morphological
10618	2722	diagnoses
10618	2723	in
10618	2724	addition
10618	2725	to
10618	2726	differential
10618	2727	diagnoses
10618	2729	which
10618	2730	involve
10618	2731	speci?c
10618	2732	comparisons
10618	2733	with
10618	2734	similar
10618	2735	taxa
10618	2736	and
10618	2737	solid
10618	2738	discus-sions
10618	2739	of
10618	2740	similarities
10618	2741	versus
10618	2742	differences
10618	2743	among
10618	2744	all
10618	2745	relevant
10618	2746	taxa
10618	2749	The
10618	2750	descriptions
10618	2751	of
10618	2752	fossils
10618	2753	are
10618	2754	clear
10618	2756	thorough
10618	2758	and
10618	2759	easily
10618	2760	readable
10618	2762	and
10618	2763	the
10618	2764	entire
10618	2765	monograph
10618	2766	is
10618	2767	rich
10618	2768	in
10618	2769	anatomical
10618	2770	detail
10618	2772	For
10618	2773	example
10618	2775	the
10618	2776	IS
10618	2777	in
10618	2778	Dryolestes
10618	2779	occurs
10618	2780	in
10618	2781	the
10618	2782	maxilla
10618	2784	re?ecting
10618	2785	a
10618	2786	primitive
10618	2787	feature
10618	2788	that
10618	2789	is
10618	2790	widespread
10618	2791	among
10618	2792	nonmammalian
10618	2793	synapsids
10618	2795	The
10618	2796	illustrations
10618	2797	are
10618	2798	generally
10618	2799	wonderful
10618	2801	Excellent
10618	2802	drawings
10618	2803	of
10618	2804	jaws
10618	2805	and
10618	2806	teeth
10618	2807	are
10618	2808	presented
10618	2809	by
10618	2810	Peter
10618	2811	Berndt
10618	2812	and
10618	2813	M.
10618	2814	Bulang-Lorcher
10618	2816	Good-quality
10618	2817	stereophotos
10618	2819	both
10618	2820	from
10618	2821	light
10618	2823	and
10618	2824	REM
10618	2826	raster
10618	2827	electron
10618	2828	micro-scopi
10618	2829	c,
10618	2830	using
10618	2831	epoxy
10618	2832	casts
10618	2835	
10618	2836	
10618	2837	otography,
10618	2839	are
10618	2840	properly
10618	2841	spaced
10618	2842	so
10618	2843	that
10618	2844	an
10618	2845	optical
10618	2846	viewer
10618	2847	is
10618	2848	unnecessary
10618	2850	Plates
10618	2851	13
10618	2852	and
10618	2853	14
10618	2854	compare
10618	2855	results
10618	2856	of
10618	2857	high-resolution
10618	2858	x
10618	2860	ray
10618	2861	techniques
10618	2862	using
10618	2863	8
10618	2865	and
10618	2866	16-bit
10618	2867	electronic
10618	2868	digital
10618	2869	micro-radiograph
10618	2870	y.
10618	2871	Detailed
10618	2872	new
10618	2873	information
10618	2874	on
10618	2875	development
10618	2876	of
10618	2877	tooth-buds
10618	2878	deep
10618	2879	in
10618	2880	the
10618	2881	jaw
10618	2882	becomes
10618	2883	visible
10618	2884	using
10618	2885	the
10618	2886	enhanced
10618	2887	imagery
10618	2889	In
10618	2890	several
10618	2891	cases
10618	2893	the
10618	2894	same
10618	2895	specimen
10618	2896	is
10618	2897	illustrated
10618	2898	using
10618	2899	various
10618	2900	techniques
10618	2902	thus
10618	2903	highlighting
10618	2904	different
10618	2905	kinds
10618	2906	of
10618	2907	features
10618	2909	Captions
10618	2910	to
10618	2911	the
10618	2912	figures
10618	2913	are
10618	2914	use-ful
10618	2915	and
10618	2916	complete
10618	2918	Isolated
10618	2919	teeth
10618	2920	typically
10618	2921	are
10618	2922	illustrated
10618	2923	in
10618	2924	four
10618	2925	views
10618	2927	occlusal
10618	2929	labial
10618	2931	mesial
10618	2933	and
10618	2934	distal
10618	2937	Also
10618	2938	provided
10618	2939	are
10618	2940	brief
10618	2941	descriptions
10618	2942	of
10618	2943	enamel-dentine
10618	2944	microstructure
10618	2945	in
10618	2946	dryolestids
10618	2948	accompanied
10618	2949	by
10618	2950	high-quality
10618	2951	SEM
10618	2952	photomicrographs
10618	2954	Species
10618	2955	from
10618	2956	Guimarota
10618	2957	provide
10618	2958	the
10618	2959	oldest
10618	2960	record
10618	2961	of
10618	2962	prismatic
10618	2963	enamel
10618	2964	among
10618	2965	the
10618	2966	Holotheria
10618	2968	They
10618	2969	also
10618	2970	demonstrate
10618	2971	the
10618	2972	most
10618	2973	primitive
10618	2974	known
10618	2975	form
10618	2976	of
10618	2977	prismatic
10618	2978	enamel
10618	2980	retained
10618	2981	among
10618	2982	Cenozoic
10618	2983	mammals
10618	2984	mainly
10618	2985	in
10618	2986	marsupials
10618	2987	and
10618	2988	insectivores
10618	2990	An
10618	2991	appendix
10618	2992	holds
10618	2993	a
10618	2994	huge
10618	2995	amount
10618	2996	of
10618	2997	data
10618	2998	from
10618	2999	dental
10618	3000	measurements
10618	3002	length
10618	3004	width
10618	3006	and
10618	3007	height
10618	3008	of
10618	3009	individual
10618	3010	teeth
10618	3012	as
10618	3013	well
10618	3014	as
10618	3015	standard
10618	3016	jaw
10618	3017	proportions
10618	3019	Gleefully
10618	3021	however
10618	3023	I
10618	3024	point
10618	3025	out
10618	3026	the
10618	3027	consistent
10618	3028	misspelling
10618	3029	of
10618	3031	Bezeichnung
10618	3033	in
10618	3034	column-headings
10618	3036	Interesting
10618	3037	proportion
10618	3039	diagrams
10618	3041	lengthzwidth
10618	3042	averages
10618	3043	for
10618	3044	tooth
10618	3045	loci
10618	3046	along
10618	3047	the
10618	3048	length
10618	3049	of
10618	3050	upper
10618	3051	and
10618	3052	lower
10618	3053	jaws
10618	3055	are
10618	3056	presented
10618	3057	and
10618	3058	compared
10618	3059	among
10618	3060	the
10618	3061	well
10618	3063	represented
10618	3064	dryolestids
10618	3066	Orientations
10618	3067	of
10618	3068	measurements
10618	3069	are
10618	3070	clearly
10618	3071	de?ned
10618	3072	and
10618	3073	were
10618	3074	taken
10618	3075	using
10618	3076	a
10618	3077	laser-based
10618	3079	High
10618	3080	Precision
10618	3081	Re?ex
10618	3082	Microscope
10618	3084	Important
10618	3085	new
10618	3086	information
10618	3087	relates
10618	3088	to
10618	3089	mandibular
10618	3090	structure
10618	3092	For
10618	3093	ex-ampl
10618	3094	e,
10618	3095	a
10618	3096	de?nite
10618	3097	facet
10618	3098	exists
10618	3099	for
10618	3100	a
10618	3101	rudimentary
10618	3102	coronoid
10618	3103	bone
10618	3104	in
10618	3105	Dry-olestes
10618	3106	leiriensis

10618	3113	bone

10618	3123	for

10618	3125	bones
10618	3126	on

10618	3129	from
10618	3130	the
10618	3131	Morrison

10618	3156	synapomorphy

10618	3161	Trechnotheria

10618	3165	exclusive
10618	3166	of

10618	3171	new

10618	3191	for
10618	3192	the
10618	3193	?rst
10618	3194	786

10618	3196	OF

10618	3198	PALEONTOLOGY
10618	3200	VOL
10618	3202	20
10618	3204	No.
10618	3205	4
10618	3207	2000
10618	3208	time
10618	3210	characters
10618	3211	from
10618	3212	upper
10618	3213	and
10618	3214	lower

10618	3240	associated

10618	3243	lower

10618	3254	sizes
10618	3255	and

10618	3259	occurrences
10618	3260	of
10618	3261	teeth
10618	3262	among
10618	3263	the
10618	3264	species
10618	3265	make
10618	3266	taxonomic
10618	3267	associations
10618	3268	virtually
10618	3269	certain
10618	3271	Martin
10618	3272	suggests
10618	3273	that
10618	3274	the
10618	3275	an-teroposterior
10618	3276	compression
10618	3277	of
10618	3278	molars
10618	3279	in

10618	3282	due
10618	3283	to
10618	3284	the
10618	3285	sec-ondary

10618	3288	molar

10618	3292	that
10618	3293	increase

10618	3298	less

10618	3300	individual

10618	3303	together

10618	3305	a
10618	3306	functional

10618	3308	of
10618	3309	teeth

10618	3983	western

10618	3989	but
10618	3990	still
10618	3991	wooded
10618	3992	biotope
10618	3993	that
10618	3994	now
10618	3995	prevails
10618	3996	in
10618	3997	warm-tem-perate
10618	3998	areas
10618	4000	This
10618	4001	change
10618	4002	in
10618	4003	vegetation
10618	4005	which
10618	4006	strongly
10618	4007	affected
10618	4008	the
10618	4009	composition
10618	4010	of
10618	4011	mammalian
10618	4012	faunas
10618	4014	seems
10618	4015	to
10618	4016	be
10618	4017	linked
10618	4018	to
10618	4019	the
10618	4020	rapid
10618	4021	spread
10618	4022	of
10618	4023	grasses
10618	4024	around
10618	4025	8???10
10618	4026	Ma
10618	4027	ago
10618	4029	Moreover
10618	4031	in
10618	4032	the
10618	4033	late
10618	4034	Neogene
10618	4036	climatic
10618	4037	shifts
10618	4038	and
10618	4039	falling
10618	4040	temperatures
10618	4041	due
10618	4042	to
10618	4043	the
10618	4044	spread
10618	4045	of
10618	4046	the
10618	4047	Ant-arctic
10618	4048	Ice
10618	4050	were
10618	4051	followed
10618	4052	by
10618	4053	the
10618	4054	Plio
10618	4056	
10618	4057	
10618	4058	esitocene
10618	4059	Arctic
10618	4060	glaciations
10618	4061	in
10618	4062	the
10618	4063	Northern
10618	4064	Hemisphere
10618	4066	.At
10618	4067	the
10618	4068	same
10618	4069	time
10618	4071	other
10618	4072	tectonic
10618	4073	processes
10618	4074	like
10618	4075	the
10618	4076	Himalayan

10618	4079	Tibetan

10618	4086	the
10618	4087	great

10618	4092	Red
10618	4093	Sea

10618	4097	in

10618	4103	processes
